intro: Gleadovia kokonorica, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, aiding in water retention. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
